Frenzy & Delirium

Frenzy and Delirium are the most feared consequences of Garou existence. They are not techniques to be mastered, but failures of control—moments when Rage overwhelms intention, or when mortal minds shatter under the weight of what they were never meant to see.

Every Garou walks with both hanging over them like a blade.

Frenzy — When Rage Takes the Reins

Frenzy occurs when a Garou loses control of their Rage.

In this state, instinct replaces reason. Thought narrows to threat, dominance, and destruction. A frenzied Garou does not choose targets—they react, often violently, to whatever their instincts deem most immediate.

Frenzy is not evil.
It is natural.
It is also catastrophic.

What Triggers Frenzy

Frenzy can be provoked by:

  • Extreme emotional stress

  • Physical injury or humiliation

  • Insults to honor or dominance

  • Prolonged suppression of Rage

  • Spiritual imbalance

Once Rage crosses a threshold, restraint becomes difficult—sometimes impossible.

The Nature of Frenzied Action

A Garou in Frenzy may:

  • Attack without regard for allies

  • Ignore pain or self-preservation

  • Destroy surroundings indiscriminately

  • Lose memory of events afterward

Even disciplined Garou are not immune. Experience reduces the risk—but never eliminates it.

The Cost of Frenzy

After Frenzy passes, consequences remain.

Trust erodes.
Allies fear proximity.
Spirits withdraw favor.
Guilt and shame linger.

Some septs forgive Frenzy as an inevitable burden. Others remember every incident.

Repeated loss of control marks a Garou as unstable—and dangerous.

Delirium — Humanity’s Breaking Point

Delirium is the psychological collapse that occurs when mortals witness a Garou in their true monstrous form.

Human minds are not built to reconcile such a sight. Faced with the impossible, they fracture—rewriting memory, denying reality, or breaking entirely.

Delirium is not fear alone.
It is survival through madness.

Effects of Delirium

A mortal affected by Delirium may:

  • Flee in blind terror

  • Become catatonic or incoherent

  • Repress or distort memory

  • Obsessively rationalize what they saw

  • Lash out violently

The stronger the Garou’s presence, the more severe the effect.

The Veil and Responsibility

Delirium is the foundation of the Veil.

Garou are forbidden to reveal themselves not because they are ashamed—but because exposure causes lasting harm. A single uncontrolled transformation can ruin lives, draw hunters, and destabilize entire communities.

A Garou who causes Delirium through recklessness is judged harshly.

Cultural Views

Garou attitudes toward Frenzy and Delirium vary.

Some see Frenzy as sacred release. Others treat it as failure. Some dismiss Delirium as humanity’s weakness. Others see it as proof that Garou were never meant to rule openly.

These beliefs shape discipline, training, and punishment within septs.

Living With the Risk

Frenzy and Delirium are not rare events.

They are ever-present threats that define how Garou live:

  • Where they fight

  • When they transform

  • Who they trust

  • How close they remain to mortals

A Garou who forgets these dangers does not survive long.

A Final Truth

The Garou fight monsters—but they are always one moment away from becoming one themselves.

Frenzy and Delirium are reminders that power without restraint is not heroism.

It is tragedy waiting for the wrong moment.
